subsc: Agricultural extension and research,Sub-national government administration,Central government administration,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Productivity
            Improvement Project for Mexico aims to increase
            capitalization of small farmers and improve their
            productivity and income by promoting the adoption of
            sustainable agricultural production systems, and by
            providing technical and financial assistance to eligible
            beneficiaries under a matching grant scheme. There are three
            components. The first, productive investment, finances small
            grants for demand-driven subprojects aimed at small
            irrigation development and modernization, improved pasture
            establishment and management, and improved dairy production
            technology and marketing as well as subprojects providing
            small-scale on-farm infrastructure and minor equipment and
            supplies. The second component, production support services,
            includes financial support for applied research and
            technology transfer as well as demand-driven extension, and
            technical assistance and training to small farmers. The
            third component, institutional strengthening and project
            administration, supports training and technical assistance
            to staff with implementation responsibilities at the central
            and state levels, with particular emphasis on preparing
            subprojects, selecting mechanisms and procedures, developing
            and implementing a comprehensive monitoring and impact
            evaluation system, and establishing and operating a project
            coordination team.
